You are a requirements analyst auditing discussion forum posts for potential feature requests.
You will be provided with a Moodle discussion forum post that includes the post title and post description. Moodle is a free and open-source learning management system (LMS) used by schools, universities, and workplaces to create online courses and manage learning activities.
Your task is to classify if the provided discussion forum post is a feature request or not for Moodle. A feature request is a post where the user asks for new functionality, missing functionality (e.g., features available in other apps), new content, or changes/improvements to existing features in future releases. Posts that are not feature requests include: bug reports, troubleshooting questions, usage questions, configuration issues, announcements, or general discussions. 
Respond strictly with one of the following labels: FEATURE_REQUEST or NOT_FEATURE_REQUEST. If the forum post is a feature request, return FEATURE_REQUEST. If the forum post is not a feature request, return NOT_FEATURE_REQUEST. Use the title of the post and the description of the post to make the assessment.
Forum Post: 
Post title: Face-to-face registration listings changed to A-Z
Post description: Hi @Dan, We've recently noticed that for workshop registrations, the format of the listings for those currently enrolled in a listed workshop has changed from the order in which registrations are received, to A-Z listings based on first name when viewing as admin user. As the formatting has changed to A-Z, it's now unclear whether the waitlist function would still be able to track next-in-line if someone registered cancels their registration. Therefore, if a workshop becomes full and several individuals are waitlisted, is the first waitlisted person still offered a position first? Does the waitlist function recognise a time-stamp of when people register to manage this, or is this new A-Z listing structure likely to impact the waitlist function for students? We look forward to your advice.
Label:

Post title: Video of Face to Face in action
Post description: Hi all. I have recently joined a new business who uses moodle as their LMS, they currently don't use face to face plugin (we require our service provider to update moodle version), at the moment F2F training is kept on a spreadsheet and separate etc. I am trying to show them the benefits of adopting the F2F plugin and how it will a more automated system and move away from manual tasks (calendars, emails etc). Does anyone have a video they can share of the F2F in action - planned calendar, booking people on, emails sent and taking attendance. I hope someone will be able to help me with this. Thanks

Forum Post: 
Post title: Wait-list user issue
Post description: Hi all, I was wondering if anyone had any problem with the users on the waiting list. In theory, users who are subscribed to the waiting list are sequentially signed up for the appointment in the event of the resignation of a user who has already been signed up. In my case, it turned out that the users on the waiting list were assigned to the meeting at random, assigning the user 14, 23, 49, or the 60 user. Has anyone encountered such a case, or can you explain to me what could have been the cause of this situation?

Forum Post: 
Post title: How to allow signing up for multiple sessions with Face-To-Face?
Post description: I did a lot of search and found that there were some PHP code hack in the year of 2012 discussion. But later discussions are saying that Face-to-Face are meant to be for one session only registration. If someone wants to re-register for a future session, they would have to be marked as "No-show" for the session that they registered before. However, we have very large population of participants and very few people to actually watch the attendance. It would be hard to compare each person and mark people who didn't show up as no-show.  Is there a way to just open up the registration list to allow multiple signing up? Thanks!!

Post title: How to assign Manager to users for signup

We have enter a default in the field and locked it and hidden it as we want to be notified for approving users into the activity. "You are currently not assigned to a manager in the system. Please contact the site administrator." The scenario is that we want the user to register, and an Administrator gets the managers email to approve the user onto the course. I am becoming very frustrated, can someone please HELP!!!!

Moving forward in Moodle, the structure we have set is: 1. within a course there are multiple topics (doing different things), 2. in one of the Topics of a Course there are multiple Face to Face activities (1 for each state  the course is presented in 3. Post title: Updating Face-to-Face mod form issue
Post description: Hi, I've encountered an issue with the Face to Face mod form, whereby, multiple email addresses are being stripped from the "Third-party email address(es)" field.  Specifically, whenever I enter emailtest01@emailtest.com,emailtest02@emailtest02.com and click the save button the data is not saved. I've had a look at the PHP code and I believe the issue arises because the $paramtype value for $mform->setType is PARAM_EMAIL but that validates single email addresses only. FIle: /mod/facetoface/mod_form.php Line 57: $mform->setType('thirdparty', PARAM_EMAIL); Regards, Michael

Forum Post: 
Post title: Issues vs Discussions
Post description: Hi all, As you may be aware this plugin is sometimes supported and sometimes not. There are a few reasons for this and I am trying to rectify some of those as I go through things and sorry for the delays. One problem that the community of users can help me with is the way in which issues are being reported. At the moment there are many different threads being opened - here, in the plugin directory feedback, github, private messages to me etc - sometimes reporting the same issue or something that might be resolved within a different version. This means that it is difficult to track the exact issues and clearly identify where and when things should be corrected and to let the community know of updated code. I have switched off bug reporting on the github directory itself in the hopes that the Moodle tracker itself becomes the only place for issues to be reported. I'd like to also build a roadmap for coming versions and feature improvements so having all the issues in one place will really help this plan moving forward. There have been, since I took over maintenance, a few things I'd like to add and alter but first I need to get the current code into a consistent state. If you experience a issue please first check the tracker to see if there is an item already reporting this which you can add to and/or vote on and if not then please create a new one. The forums and plugin comments should ideally be used only for questions regarding general support such as configuration questions, suggestions for features and their related discussions and general use or feedback of the module. I will not be able to support bugs reported in these locations. In the meantime, thank you for your patience, Stacey

Forum Post: 
Post title: Backup without user data
Post description: Guys, We have come across a small issue, when we back up a course not saving user data, the other thing that goes missing is the session information for the course. (Actually, anything which is held in the mdl_facetoface_session_data). However, if you do the backup with user data, and restore without user data, then it works. The issue is within the backup_facetoface_stepslib.php - line 128 $session_data_element->set_source_table('facetoface_session_data', array('sessionid' => backup::VAR_PARENTID)); which does the back up of the data only if user data is selected. I would recommend it be removed out of the user backup section and place it in the data backup section. (I moved it to line 121 before the line if ($userinfo) { This allows things like location to be backed up without user data. Cheers Peter

Forum Post: 
Post title: Upgrading facetoface from 2007091300 to 2013010400
Post description: Hi, I'm in the process of upgrading from Moodle 1.9.19 to 2.2.6 (I realise these are ageing versions with limited-to-no support) which involved upgrading facetoface from 2007091300 to 2013010400 and there were multiple issues. To resolve these I had to make changes to mod/facetoface/db/upgrade.php, I've attached the patch to this post. To summarise the issues: $dbman->add_field(), create_table() and drop_field() appears to return void so don't assign this to $result. (This appears to be already known: https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=217299 ). $OUTPUT->notification() is an empty object, add $OUTPUT to the list of globals at the start of xmldb_facetoface_upgrade(). Property $DB->debug isn't accessible (protected) so remove these. The second parameter for $DB->get_records() should be either null or an array. The field list for $DB->get_records() should be in the fourth parameter. Unless of course there's something very wrong with my installation. All the best, Leon

Post title: F2F "No Show" Bug / Feature?
Post description: OK - combining F2F with Activity Tracker, and we came across a curious instance where if a student was marked as a No Show in the Face to Face session, they were showing as successully completed the module. Of course, as I have customised both, I went back to basics to find it, and here is what I found. Regardless of the result of the Face to Face session, (Fully attended, partially attended, no show) Face to Face still injects a completion status of 1 into the table mdl_course_modules_completion . (Note - if course completion is set to require 100% to pass, this is not an issue - just reporting through Activity Tracker, which utilises the completionstatus flag in mdl_course_modules_completion ) Now one could argue either way for this - that they technically have completed the module, however got a pass mark of 0%, or they have not completed the module because they didn't turn up. Myself - I argue the second option - but interesting to see other thoughts out there. Any one with thoughts? Cheers Peter

Post title: F2F - Manager Approval Issue
Post description: Hi Alastair , I found an interesting bug today.... A F2F course requires manager approval, and a user signs up to the course. An email is sent to the manager, and the student - all is good. However, the student is not given an indication on the screen that they are waitlisted, so they can sign in again. The big gotcha, is once they sign in a second time, even once they are approved and the status as an admin says booked, the end user still has the status as being able to sign up. They will NEVER see on their screen that they are booked in - they will always get the option to sign up. Of course, if they sign up again AFTER they are approved, then they get un-booked and put as waiting for approval, and the whole cycle starts again. Any thoughts? This is latest iteration of F2F and moodle 2.4.3+ (Dated this week) Cheers Peter

Forum Post: 
Post title: F2F Report bug
Post description: Hi Alastair, We had our big launch, and of course a few days before had staff madly adding Face to Face sessions (a few hundred) We were going through the logs and kept finding these seamlessly random students have added a F2F session - needless to say we were incredibly confused. After some chasing, we have found that F2F was injecting into the mdl_log database , and for some reason using the activityid as the userid - hence why we were getting random students in the log... (Including students that had never logged in) I found that line 209 in sessions.php seems to be the culprit add_to_log($course->id, 'facetoface', 'added session', 'facetoface', 'sessions.php?f='.$facetoface->id, $facetoface->id, $cm->id); My suggested correction is add_to_log($course->id, 'facetoface', 'added session',  'sessions.php?f='.$facetoface->id, $facetoface->id, $cm->id); Let me know if you want me to raise a tracker for this? (I haven't done one before.... could be interesting) Cheers Peter

Is there a way to recover from this? The " Server Checks" page says that everything is ok.  I'm running PHP ver 5.3.8 and mysql ver 5.1.65.14.0.    I installed moodle ver 2.2.6 (planning to then upgrade to ver 2.3). Post title: Facetoface 2.2.2 Released
Post description: Hi Everyone, I have just uploaded a new version of Face-to-face to the plugin database . It contains a number of fixes including the "Expect 1, got 0" issues that a number of people have been experiencing. https://moodle.org/plugins/pluginversions.php?plugin=mod_facetoface Here is a full list of the changes/fixes: Bug fixes: - Prevent direct access to conditional activities - Ensure site calendar is updated when activity is updated - Fix hardcoded language string in attendees.php - Make sure notices are sent from email specified in settings - Fix fatal error when deleting data from custom session field - Fix display of images in facetoface description - Stop error being thrown when creating session Improvements: - Create new iCal UID for every session re-signup Cheers, Alastair

Post title: facetoface new condition "session is over"
Post description: Hello, I am currently working on the module facetoface to be able to use "Restrict access" -> "Activity completion condition" in the setting of the module. My idea was to: 1- Enable the Completion tracking "Show activity as complete when conditions are met " for facetoface to unlock the conditions "Require view" and "Require grade". 2- Create a third condition call "Session is over" which, if enable, will consider the course module for the current user as complete IF the current user is still signup for a session with the status "session over" 3- implement the condition "session is over" in the module facetoface and in moodle. For now it is working, I based the condition "session is over" on the condition "require view" and now every time the course page is view the condition check if the current user is still signup for a session over. I had to modify many things, I explain all the modifications I had to make in the .txt document. I am still working on to try a maximum to not modify the moodle code but the facetoface code instead, I would be very happy to have your opinion or your ideas to improve what I have done so far. Also i create a php file : Session_over.php to put at the root of facetoface.I wanted to give you the modified php files but when I create this discussion I couldnt upload more than 100kb.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Calendar shows time for a different session
Post description: We're using the face-to-face module with a somewhat customized 1.9.2 version. It doesn't happen all the time, but sometimes sessions appear on learner calendars with the times from a different session. For example, let's say that Joe is signed up for two different courses: Tuesday at 10:30 AM Wednesday at 10:30 AM In Joe's calendar, the Tuesday session appears correctly as being at 10:30 AM. However, his Wednesday session shows up as being at 2:30 PM (which happens to be the time of another available session, but he isn't signed up for that). I've verified that Joe is enrolled in the right sessions, and Joe can see the correct time if he enters the activity through the weekly outline rather than the calendar. Everything in the activity itself is right, but somehow the information is getting lost when it gets shared with the calendar. Any ideas on why this might be happening? -Christy Tucker

Forum Post: 
Post title: Send VCAL invites rather than ICAL invites
Post description: Hi all I just realised that it is possible to send face-to-face invitations to user's primary Outlook calendar (rather than an internet calendar).  I thought this might be useful information for other people, so I'm posting it here. What I did was: Open the mod\facetoface\lib.php file Change all references to iCAL to vCAL (watch out for a few words that have ical in them - like practical). Change all references to .ics to .vcs. It seems to be working really well so far.  Fingers crossed I don't run into any problems!

Post title: Activity Locking vs Using a Child Course
Post description: Our courses consist of blended learning. Right now we have two moodle courses set up for each course. One course is for the live instruction portion for which we use face to face. The second is for the online learning content where we have uploaded scorm content. The course is sequential meaning that the online content does not become available until the user completes the live instruction course. I tried using Activity Locking (I'm don't fully understand all of its features yet) but the problems I have are two fold: 1 - We run the same live instruction course in dozens of cities. Each instance/session is its own face-to-face and a user need only attend one face to face session to be eligible for the online content. It seems as if the activity lock is an all or nothing proposition, I can't set it to say that any face-to-face attendance would qualify to unlock the online learning content. 2 - The online learning content is accessible for 60 days from the face-to-face/live session attendance. Any ideas on how to control this? Right now we do this manually. Thank you

Post title: Confirmation emails : how to delay & trigger the sending ?
Post description: Hello, I am looking for an easy way to delay the sending of confirmation email in the face to face module. On my sandbox environment, the email is sent immediately after I assign an attendee to the session, which can cause problem if I select the wrong person in the list for example. I would like to explore different ways: - either having a confirmation button before sending the confirmation email (kind of approving the attendee's list, that would send the email to the whole list at one time) - or be able to setup a number of days before the session date to send the email for ex. 7 days before (my session events are often de-scheduled ans re-scheduled so I do not want to pollute users mailbox for nothing). This feature could also be used for reminder emails some days before the session. I have seen we can disable the email confirmation. If I do so and enable it while having already a list of attendees, what happens ? can we then send the confirmation mail to the list ?? Did anyone already developped something on this subject ? Feedbacks appreciated. Thanks for your help Sandrine

Forum Post: 
Post title: Attendence linked to online course enrollment
Post description: Let me start off by explaining the situation. We use Moodle to train technicians around the world but one state requires us to provide face-to-face classes for the technician's first training. After they have taken the face-to-face class they are able to renew their training by taking a course online. (Our training certificates expire every 2 years) The problem is setting up a course just for that particular state that has enrollment limited to those technicians that have already taken a face-to-face class. Some changes would probably need to be made to the core Moodle files as well as the face-to-face code but I would love to have the face-to-face attendence be linked to the online course enrolment somehow. I don't want to have them automatically enrolled in the online course after they attend the face-to-face so the current external enrollment modules won't work for me. When a students attempts to enroll in the online course I would like to have moodle check to verify they have already taken the related face-to-face class, if they have they are enrolled, if they haven't they are told they need to take the face-to-face class first.

Post title: User cannot sign up for a 2nd f2f session in the same course
Post description: Please forgive me if this is a duplicate post, but I did not locate it on the forum. I ran across an interesting issue today....a user was trying to sign up for a face to face session for the second time (he had already signed up for a previous session and wanted a refresher). The user received a message that "(Username) is already signed up for this face-to-face activity." If I remove his attendance history from the previous session, then he can successfully be added into the current session. Although that is a short-term workaround, I would prefer not to use it in order to keep the integrity of our attendance records. Forum Post: 
Post title: Making an individual session unavailable for booking
Post description: All I needed a way to make an individual session unavailable for booking.  Basically the instructor wanted to add students to specific sessions manually without the student signing up themselves.  To do this I changed the code in face-to-face/lib.php as shown below: // Only numbers allowed here $session->capacity = preg_replace('/[^\d]/', '', $session->capacity); $MAX_CAPACITY = 100000; if ($session->capacity < 0) { //changed from a 1 to a 0 to allow session capacity to be set to 0 so sessions can be closed. $session->capacity = 1; } elseif ($session->capacity > $MAX_CAPACITY) { $session->capacity = $MAX_CAPACITY; } The scenario is this:  The instructor has a session that has 25 seats, but 15 of those seats need to be held for a specific department.  Once those 15 seats are filled then the instructor opens the session for anyone else that wants to register.  Setting the capacity to 0 effectively allows the session to be created but makes the session unavailable for students to book.  The instructor(s) adds the 15 students from the department and then two weeks before class starts they change the capacity to the actual capacity of the class opening up the remaining seats to whoever wants to book it. I hope I have explained this well.  In my testing it seems to be working beautifully, I just wonder if I am breaking something else by doing this.  ANy thoughts of comments? Scott Karren

Forum Post: 
Post title: Face-to-face 1.4.0 released!
Post description: A new version of the Face-to-face module has been released. It is highly recommended that you upgrade to it since it includes some security fixes . New features in this release: There is now a list of user cancellations on the attendance page. The Participants report shows the expected data. User-level activity reports ("Outline" and "Complete" reports) are also populated. Other noteworthy improvements: The module now uses a custom field on the user profile page for the manager's email address instead of the MSN field. The attendance data is now stored in the gradebook. Important bug fixes: The session key is now checked in all user forms. The take attendance page now displays the actual attendance and allows teachers to untick checkboxes. iCalendar appointments are no longer sent for wait-listed sessions. Remove internationalisation from log entries. Default email messages are no longer set in the site-wide settings page, they should simply be overridden in the language pack. Francois, Catalyst IT

Post title: Face-to-face 1.2.0 released!
Post description: A new and improved version of the Face-to-face module is now ready to be downloaded: Download latest version It includes the following new features: Teachers can now sign users up for a session, even after the fact. Open Document Format support when downloading attendance Dutch translation by Peter-Anne Wissema But perhaps more importantly, it fixes a number of bugs, including these: Always mark reminders as sent, even when the email to the manager failed. Fix the default permissions to fix problems where a user is both student and teacher. Add an empty db/upgrade.php to fix upgrade problems on Moodle 1.9 Respect the system's date and currency format when displaying dates and costs. More details are available in the change log . As usual, please report bugs in the tracker or ask for help in this forum. Francois, Catalyst IT

Post title: Time Zone
Post description: Hi All We're just moving our training operations over to Moodle 4.3 and with a fairly global reach we really need to be able to schedule Face to Face sessions in different time zones. Is there any easy way to do this and for the time zone to appear in any API call to pull F2F session data from the database ? Thanks in advance Rgds Bob
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: By default the sessions should all show in the user's own timezone, so if an event is scheduled in US Central Timezone for 10:00 AM, but the viewing users is in India, the viewer will see it as scheduled at 9:30 PM. I believe at the database level the data is stored as a unix timestamp.

Post title: Road map for F2F or contact to a development company selling a more advanced plugin?
Post description: Hi ave used Totara for several years and am now using moodle with the f2f plugin. I am missing some options in the moodle plugin and am wondering if there is any road map for the current F2F or if you know any moodle development  companies who sells a fork of F2F with more functionality, such as the ability to turn of notifications, stop ical sending out on bulk, rich editor etc?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: HI Jeanette, Moodle Workplace also has a facetoface style feature and I think they have an ongoing roadmap for overall improvements, so you might find that Workplace might also suit your needs. We don't have a roadmap for the open source plugin - we try to make sure that it continues to work in future releases, but feature development is completely reliant on community contributions or clients directly funding a specific feature improvement. If you're interested in funding development on the open source facetoface activity, feel free to reach out privately and we can look at providing an estimate to implmement the features you are looking for. thanks!

Forum Post: 
Post title: How to allow signing up for multiple sessions with Face-To-Face?
Post description: I did a lot of search and found that there were some PHP code hack in the year of 2012 discussion. But later discussions are saying that Face-to-Face are meant to be for one session only registration. If someone wants to re-register for a future session, they would have to be marked as "No-show" for the session that they registered before. However, we have very large population of participants and very few people to actually watch the attendance. It would be hard to compare each person and mark people who didn't show up as no-show.  Is there a way to just open up the registration list to allow multiple signing up? Thanks!!
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: I am also looking for a solution for this. Does anyone have the hack they can post here? Thanks!
Comment 2: I've been using face-to-face for 11 years and the answer has been NO the whole time. Marking them anything will allow them to re-register. Just mark each session. If you don't care if they actually attend or not, mark everyone attended... And for the inevitable next question, (can we have a select all?) probably not. I've asked the question several times over the years and again, the answer has been no. But it sure would be nice. I've heard the original developers have taken f2f up several levels but I don't think the new code is available to the community (and, that might just be hearsay).
Comment 3: Thanks Melanie. As to marking them anything - I cannot see that option at the moment?? Finally do you know of any other booking systems that allow this in Moodle? Was looking at 'Booking', but I cannot actually test it on moodlebites cause it doesn't let me create a new account. Essentially we run a series of workshops at different times and we want students to be able to sign up to multple AND receive email confirmations and notifications. Any help much appreciated. Thanks
Comment 4: If it does not give you the option to take attendance, the date is still in the future. You can only take attendance after the session begins. Back in '08, still in the days of 1.9...I did a bunch of research on something like this. I found nothing that has the functionality of f2f...attendance might be more what you're looking for...but I think it tracks more of a day to day thing and, again, requires marking. At my prior job, we customized f2f to add an attendance by id option. We all had magnetic strip ID badges that had our id numbers coded in, so we could connect a usb swiper (or use a keyboard with a swiper) and as people walked in, they could swipe for attendance. Or the teacher could type in their ID's manually. Or could copy the list of swipes and paste it in for additional sessions (we frequently had back to back classes and people were required to attend several on the same day). It was pretty slick. The guy who wrote the code said it wasn't too hard. But that was a code hack and I can't share it...I don't work there any longer and they a) stopped using moodle and b) were resistant to sharing (I don't know why, the director was like that. Didn't like Moodle or open source, liked secret squirrel, now he's paying over $50,000 a year for something that doesn't have the flexibility Moodle has).

Post title: How to assign Manager to users for signup
Post description: Howdy all, I have read all the post I can find on this matter. We have installed the face-to-face plugin and using moodle 3.5. We have created the user profile field 'Managers email' and short name managersemail . We have enter a default in the field and locked it and hidden it as we want to be notified for approving users into the activity. I have gone backwards and forwards checking all the fields and spelling and cannot fix the problem of when the user tries to register it informs them that they do not have a manger assigned. "You are currently not assigned to a manager in the system. Please contact the site administrator." The scenario is that we want the user to register, and an Administrator gets the managers email to approve the user onto the course. I am becoming very frustrated, can someone please HELP!!!!
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi again, After some more investigation I found that in earlier versions to make this work you had to fill the 'MSN ID' field, I did this and it worked. The problem is we want to be able to hide and lock the info into a default so our admins could get the managers emails. Having the 'managers email' location method working is needed for our propose. We can't hid the 'MSN ID' field.
Comment 2: That's very odd...in the 2.5 version (and before), when you installed the plugin, it added a custom user field "Manager's email" and it looked for that.  Now it does something different, which is kind of weird.
Comment 3: I agree with Melanie that this sounds strange. What version of Moodle and what version of Face-to-face are you seeing this issue? I haven't noticed this issue and we are using managersemail successfully with multiple versions of Moodle and the latest versions of Face-to-face. Jeremy
Comment 4: Moodle          : 3.5 Face to Face : 3.4.4  2018110900 Answer to Melaines post, there isn't a default 'Managers email'.  I had to create one myself As soon as I enter data into the MSNID, it works fine.
Comment 5: I am also having issues with the Manager email. I created the manager email custom field as suggested in another post on the profile and it still doesn't work.   I request the user to enter the email and it doesn't appear to save that information anywhere that I can find....not even in the MSNID field if populating that field is what makes the plugin work properly. Any suggestions? Moodle 3.5 F2F version:  3.4.3  (2018110900)
Comment 6: Hi Dave, I'm too in need of figuring out a way that we can have one of our staff auto added to the manager field so that we can approve requests internally. Did you ever figure this out?
Comment 7: I am too looking into finding a solution for this - have tried everything I could find online. we are on 3.6.3
Comment 8: Managed to get this working on our 3.6.3 Steps: Created a test course - added two users, assigned one as a student and other as Manager Added the 'Managers Email' field in the user profile field in the 'Other fields' section (short name managersemail). Opened 'Edit Profile' page for student user and added the Manager user's email address Created an F-to-F activity, with approval required option checked. Added a session. Signed up on the activity with student user and I did not get the error/message. Both the student user and Manager user received an email confirmation of the booking Hope it helps other people. However, now trying to work out how to add the manager email detail to the respective 1000+ user accounts on our system

Forum Post: 
Post title: Guest access to Face-to-Face not working
Post description: Beating my head against the desk right now. Using Moodle 3.6.3 with Boost theme. Been trying for two days to get Face-to-Face sessions working with guest access. Have gone through every site admin setting I can find, including: Settings>Site administration>Plugins>Authentication> Manage authentication Settings>Site administration>Plugins>Enrollments> Guest access Settings>Site administration>Plugins>Enrollments> Manage enroll plugin Settings>Site administration>Users>Permissions> Define roles Settings>Site administration>Users>Permissions> User policies I've set all courses to allow guests to view and enroll, system-wide by default. I've turned on auto-enroll. I've double-checked each FtF session and ensured that guest access is on. Guests system-wide have access to enroll in any session. Have set it so no password is required to enroll. There are no restrictions in place at the course, topic or session level. Guest access has never had a password requirement, so it seems unlikely that it has a corrupted password. Every time I click sign up for a session, I get, "Sorry, guests are not allowed to sign up for sessions."
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Guests can access the course but they cannot access activities .  Of they are not enrolled in the class, the class won't have a way to track them.  I suppose you could override guest roles but that is not one I would recommend changing.  The point of requiring people to be students is to track what they are doing--guest access is not tracked, therefore having them participate is pointless...
Comment 2: Thanks for the reply. Yeah, the guest thing is unorthodox, but I was looking into that route thanks to a bureaucratic snafu. We will be offering computer training classes on this platform. Most of the students will have access via LDAP or OAuth, but there will be times when we have some warehouse folks taking courses as well, and most of them do not have either of those login options. (We were, of course, not informed of this until way into the process of setting up the server and the software, go figure). We were also told late in the game that some warehouse managers might want to bulk enroll their employees. The biggest issue is that (as near as I can tell), Moodle requires each student to have an email address. While I completely understand the need for that, it really limits our options for solving the problem. HR won't let them use personal emails. I'd just have them all register under their manager's email address, but I'm pretty sure Moodle doesn't allow that, either. Any ideas would be greatly appreciated.
Comment 3: AH!  Well, you could create fake emails. But then they wouldn't get notices...but it sounds like they might not anyway. Yea, Moodle does require each account to have an email and usually prevents duplicates BUT I think you can disable that...or create accounts via a bulk upload with the duplicated email--just make sure to change the prevent duplicate emails from yes to no. If HR doesn't want them to use personal email then they need to make sure they have company emails.

Forum Post: 
Post title: face-to-face - displays as 'complete' even if learner was marked as 'no show'
Post description: Hi, I have been configuring a face-to-face activity and have noticed that when I mark a learner as 'no show', then the activity is still being set as 'complete' for them. Is there any way to tie passing grade to completion in this activity type? Thanks, Bruce
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Unfortunately not at this time. Partially attended gets recorded as a 50, fully attended as 100, and no show as a zero. Those are all grades, so completion is triggered for all of them. I usually recommend using grade restrictions on a later activity that has more robust completion options, such as feedback, to trigger course completion.
Comment 2: How would I set course completion to only occur for example for a grade of 100%? I have several sessions that a learner can choose from, they only need to attend one fully to pass... Is that possible through grade book? If so, can you provide an example? Thanks
Comment 3: Set a grade to pass and it won't give completion. So...step 1, must receive a grade (but not view, that can jack things up massively). Step 2: Grades, Gradebook setup, Edit/Edit settings for the F2F, Set your Grade to pass to 50 or 100 (whatever you expect). Save.  You might need to click Show more to see the Grade to pass.
Comment 4: At least in my testing on the latest version of the plugin and Moodle 3.5 and 3.6 that will still mark the activity as complete, but completed (did not achieve pass grade). So if course completion is tied to activity completion that will still mark as complete despite the no show. In some plugins there is an option to restriction completion to a passing grade, but F2F doesn't support that. So in this use case I would set the required course grade to 75 or 100 for course completion rather than rely on activity completion, or if there are other activities I would use a grade restriction instead of an activity completion to restrict access to the later activities. Jeremy
Comment 5: F2F does work with passing grade, but you have to set it manually in the gradebook. There is not a specific 'require passing grade' the way quiz or other modules have within settings, though. I've been requiring a passing grade this way for course and activity settings for years...

Post title: Can I turn off all notifictions in Face-to-Face?
Post description: I am setting up some classroom events using this plugin, but many of our students do not access their email and would find the notifications and reminders bothersome. For sessions in the past, the plugin has the logic to turn off the reminders and displays session over on the course activity. For future sessions I was hoping for single checkbox on the initial page to "turn-off" all reminders. Then of course there is most hoping that administrators (instructors) would have a easy way of marking the attendance for all enrolled (select all) and allowing them to select the date of the event vs the current date. Instructors/administrators often do not receive the attendance roster on the same day as the event. Kind Regards, Shirley
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: I doubt it.  If you manually register (and then properly enroll, sense manual registration may add people to the course with no role), you can check the 'don't send email' box but I have never seen a way to block it if people sign themselves up. They can choose whether to get one or two emails but not to shut off email entirely. There is no native way to take attendance for everyone--at a previous job one of my techy coworkers wrote a script to add a link to the options which opened a page where you could enter an id number for each attendee and then submit in bulk.  It would also manually enroll people who showed up without signing up.  It was pretty slick.  But it did require an ID number. Our staff had a badge with an embedded code for their ID so they could swipe into the job sites...his code added something that with a USB swiper would read the id and made it super fast. Unfortunately, I don't have that code.  I thought he posted it for the community many years ago but have not been able to find it if he did...
Comment 2: Hello Melanie, That was super helpful. I have many classroom sessions over the next few weeks and the thought of marking attendee one-by-one and answering the pop-up is making my brain numb. I will dream on....and click away. Thank you!

Post title: Importing data into Face to Face format from old LMS
Post description: Howdy, Is there a way of importing data from and existing Learning Management System into a face to face format in Moodle for historical records. We are switching over to Moodle and have data from or old system which has the structure of multiple Classes within a course, the equivalent to multiple Sessions in a Topic in Moodle. Moving forward in Moodle, the structure we have set is: 1. within a course there are multiple topics (doing different things), 2. in one of the Topics of a Course there are multiple Face to Face activities (1 for each state  the course is presented in 3. In each fact to Face activity there are multiple sessions which are run in each State We want to be able to import all the historical classes into the session within each state activity of face to face. We have tried it, and each imported class becomes its own course with blank topics in them. this then makes it hard as there becomes so many courses, and a mess. some of these courses prerequisites for future course, and instead of just making the prerequisite for 1 course, we will have to create it for every course (Too many) Please Help, I am a novice at this and the person which was assisting (which was more experienced) is no longer working for our company.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Dave, There isn't a straightforward way to do that in Moodle. You'd have to create the course shells and then manually import the data and mark the session attendance again for each one. There isn't anything out there for Moodle, at this moment, that will do this automatically. There are options in Totara though. Jeremy
Comment 2: Thanks

Forum Post: 
Post title: Can I use Face-to-Face to create an event in the past
Post description: Hello, I recently started using the course recompletion plug-in and it solves my bi-annual certification problems when the course content is on the LMS. However, I have other external courses that award certificates that I need to send out reminders to employees and their managers that the student has an approaching due date for recertification. Can I use face-to-face to create a course events in the past + the course recompletion plug-in to automate my external certifications? Kind Regards, Shirley
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: I don't know anything about the recompletion plug-in, but you can create course events in the past--but you have to manually add attendees.  If you don't suppress notification, it will notify them as well--which might be what you want.
Comment 2: Thank you Melanie! Can I mark the student's participation in the past? Or will Moodle mark the participation as of the "current date"?
Comment 3: Shirley, You can track past events using Face-to-face; however, the completion in Moodle will use the current date. Jeremy
Comment 4: Thank you for sharing with me. This is unfortunate that an administrator cannot set the student's participation date - I will not be able to use the course recompletion plug-in for my external certificate requirements. I guess I am back to manually tracking off-line.
Comment 5: As an admin, you can always modify those dates.  I'm not recommending it, but it is possible--If you use adminer,  you can hunt down specific sessions and bulk change the completion dates and go to the course completion status and bulk change the completion date there, too.  Again...not advocating, just saying...
Comment 6: Hi Shirley, You may want to consider using the Reengagement plugin and the Recompletion plugin in combination. Reengagement will remind/email users after a time frame has elapsed. Recompletion will strip out grades and notify users. This also renders the certificate unavailable to the user. We have found by using Custom Certificate that if the user repeats activities a new certificate will become available (even though the certificate summary page would suggest otherwise) I do not believe Recompletion has been adapted for face-to-Face use yet. Cheers Mark

Forum Post: 
Post title: I would like a print attendance register option
Post description: I've created an sql report and used a template, which does the job but includes people who cancel. The report shows everyone with a 50 in facetoface_signups_status.statuscode, and hides everyone with a 10. Them problem is everyone gets a 50 and then a 10 when cancels, so everyone shows up regardless. Any other solutions are welcome.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: There is an additional entry called superceded - if you only show those with 0 in this table, it will filter out those who have cancelled. I did think the status code was 70 though, not 50? I use a similar thing - config report below. Note - discountcode I use to produce a blank cell for the signature - we don't use discount code. select c.shortname, f.name AS SessionName, DATE_FORMAT(FROM_UNIXTIME(fsd.timestart),'%e %M %Y')  AS 'Date', DATE_FORMAT(FROM_UNIXTIME(fsd.timestart),'%h:%i %p') AS 'Time', u.username AS 'Payroll Number',  CONCAT(u.firstname, ' ', u.lastname) AS Name, fs.discountcode AS Signature from prefix_user AS u INNER JOIN prefix_facetoface_signups as fs on u.id=fs.userid INNER JOIN prefix_facetoface_sessions_dates as fsd on fs.sessionid=fsd.sessionid INNER JOIN prefix_facetoface_sessions AS fse
Comment 2: Just spotted I haven't updated this. I created an html - php form to achieve the attendance register. Now the tutor doesn't even need to sign in to moodle.

Post title: F2F Enrolment >> no role
Post description: Hi all, We are using Moodle 3.0.4 (build: 20160623)  and Face-to-Face 2.8.0 (build: 2015021300) Some teachers of ours are adding students to sessions who are not previously enrolled in the course using the "Add" function. This results in the user being added to the course but with no role . The user then has no ability to participate in activities . Users who were previously enrolled into the course have the student role as expected. When added to the session they retain the student role and can participate in all activities. Is this normal behaviour for Face-to Face? OR is there a way to add users to a session (F2F) so that they are given the student role ?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Well, yes, this is "normal" for relative values in f2f.  I tell anyone who uses it to track classroom training to make sure to enroll students first.  But people frequently forget. I think there might be a 2.9 build where the maintainer might have addressed this...but I'm still on an old build, myself. Most of our users have an employee id...we added some code that let's us take attendance by id and takes care of three steps at once--enrollment, registration/booking and attendance.  Works really well for us.
Comment 2: Thanks Melanie... good confirmation.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Report on which enrolled students have not signed up to a F2F session
Post description: I was wondering if there's any kind of report I can run to tell me which enrolled students on a course are yet to sign up to any of the sessions available for a mandatory F2F activity?  I'd like to send a chaser email to all enrolees who are yet to sign up to a session. Thanks Emily
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: It has to be done via SQL . You basically need to pull the enrolled users, and then exclude those booked/attended in your facetoface session. It would be something like this: SELECT u.id, u.username, u.firstname, u.lastname, u.email FROM mdl_role_assignments ra JOIN mdl_user u ON u.id = ra.userid JOIN mdl_role r ON r.id = ra.roleid JOIN mdl_context cxt ON cxt.id = ra.contextid JOIN mdl_course c ON c.id = cxt.instanceid WHERE ra.userid = u.id AND ra.contextid = cxt.id AND cxt.contextlevel =50 AND cxt.instanceid = c.id The nested SELECT could probably use less joins (the session date table is complete unnecessary in this case, for example), I simply grabbed it from another query I had saved.

Forum Post: Post title: Time in reminder emails is not correct. Post description: I am finding that the time listed in the Face-to-Face reminder email is not the same as the time listed on the site for that sessions. If someone logs into my Moodle site and the time zone in their profile is set to Pacific time (they live in California) the start time for the face-to-face sessions will show 8:30am which is correct. When they receive the reminder email the start time is listed as 10:30am. As you can imagine this is causing some confusion. I am wondering if the time in the reminder email is the server local time which in my case is Central time. This would make sense give that 8:30am Pacific time is 10:30am Central time. Please help. Thanks, Dustin Elliott Comments associated with the post: Comment 1: Hello everybody, In addition to this question, I was wondering how exactly the timezones are used in Moodle. Did not find the information in doc nor forum. I have exactly the same need as Dustin and would like to be able to send 3 different time information in the confirmation and reminder emails: - Student time (different attendees of the session can be in different timezones) - teacher time - Server's local time Which zones do I have to use to perform this ? Did anyone already do that with the correct informatiion at the end ? Thanks in advance for help, Sandrine Comment 2: Ciao Does the facetoface module use the timezone of the system for ICAL appointments and remainder emails? How could I manage facetoface sessions for locations with different timezones? Maybe adding a new field "Timezone" in the form add/edit of facetoface sessions could be the solution... Waiting for your feedbacks Regards Matteo Comment 3: Hi Matteo, We currently assume that the server timezone is the same as the user timezone. It would be good to remove that assumption. If you wanted to change this, have a look at all uses of "userdate()" in /mod/facetoface/lib.php The optional third parameter to userdate() is the timezone. For each user we send an email to, we should use his/her own timezone. Let me know if you get somewhere with this. I'd be happy to get this fixed. Cheers, Francois Comment 4: Ciao Regarding the email notification, maybe the best/easiest solution (that doesn't not require ALL the users set correctly their timezone) is sending to all the users the same absolute time (for instance from 09:00 UTC to 17:00 UTC) Regarding the ICAL file, the ICAL appointment should contain an absolute time (for instance UTC): the Calendar Clients will convert the absolute time to a localtime using the user's timezone (in MS Outlook, Google Calendar,... you can set your timezone) Regards Matteo Comment 5: I agree with using UTC for the iCal attachments. They should be displayed properly by the client. On the other hand, in the emails, we should be using the user timezone (as set in Moodle) because that's what users will see when they are logged in and sign up for the session. Cheers, Francois Comment 6: Hi 1) ICAL attachment do you have any idea about this feature will be implemented? 2) EMAIL yes, you are right but usually the timezone is not an Corporate/ LDAP attribute but an Operating System setting and so it is not easy (think also to the "Daylight Saving Time" issue) to manage moodle timezone for thousands of worldwide students.. In any case (specially when a student does not setup correctly his/her timezone) in facetoface session lists view ( /moodle/mod/facetoface/view.php?id=XX) , it would be nice to show an ABSOLUTE time: simply adding the timezone of the student (for instance from 09:00 to 17:00 UTC+2).. In this case a worldwide student cannot have doubts about which timezone the time is related to (maybe Location? teacher? Student?). What do you think about it? Thanks Matteo Comment 7: Hi Matteo, We don't have any plans regarding the iCal changes yet, so if anybody wants to have a go, feel free. Regarding emails, we could optionally include the timezone as part of what we display. For example, it would show "9am to 5pm NZST" on a New Zealand Moodle, 09:00 to 17:00 UTC+2 on a European server). That way, it would be clear what the timezone is and it would not penalise those who take the time to set user timezones properly. Thank you! Comment 9: Hi Dorel I tested your code and it works fine. Many Thanks! I think this small patch would be useful for all F2F users... is it possibile to add it in the standard source code repository? Redards Matteo Comment 10: Hi, Matteo, I made i small modifcation to the code, because the localserver timezone was hardcoded. If you want to obtain it dinamically you can use a function to calculate the delta between the local time and UTC . So the code should look like this : $timezonul=$USER->timezone; ( or $timezonul=$user->timezone) if (($timezonul == '99') AND (tzdelta()>=0) ) { $timezonul = "+".tzdelta() ;} else if (($timezonul == '99') AND (tzdelta()<0)) {$timezonul = tzdelta();} function tzdelta ( $iTime = 0 ) { if ( 0 == $iTime ) { $iTime = time(); } $ar = localtime ( $iTime ); $ar[5] += 1900; $ar[4]++; $iTztime = gmmktime ( $ar[2], $ar[1], $ar[0], $ar[4], $ar[3], $ar[5], $ar[8] ); return ( $iTztime - $iTime ) /3600; } Now you can elimnate also the + sign after the UTC string and so you will have corect data even for servers with localtime bellow 0 UTC . ' to '.userdate($date->timefinish, get_string('strftimetime')); //custom $alldates .=' UTC'.$timezonul; ....... //custom $msg = str_replace(get_string('placeholder:finishtime', 'facetoface'), $finishtime.' UTC '.$timezonul,$msg); ..... function facetoface_print_sessions($courseid, $facetofaceid, $location) { ....... $timezonul=$USER->timezone; if (($timezonul == '99') AND (tzdelta()>=0) ) { $timezonul = "+".tzdelta() ;} else if (($timezonul == '99') AND (tzdelta()<0)) {$timezonul = tzdelta();} $tableprevious .= '' .......... //custom . ''.$allsessiontimes.' '.' UTC '.$timezonul.' ...... $tableupcoming .= '' . ''.$allsessiontimes.' '.' UTC '.$timezonul.'' ..... // separate function in lib.php // calculate the delta between the local time and UTC in the case of the timezone set to server localtime function tzdelta ( $iTime = 0 ) { if ( 0 == $iTime ) { $iTime = time(); } $ar = localtime ( $iTime ); $ar[5] += 1900; $ar[4]++; $iTztime = gmmktime ( $ar[2], $ar[1], $ar[0], $ar[4], $ar[3], $ar[5], $ar[8] ); return ( $iTztime - $iTime )/3600; } and in the signup.html page if (!$addmanager and !$confirmmanager and !$changemanager) { // Generic form (no manager action) $timezonul=$USER->timezone; if (($timezonul == '99') AND (tzdelta()>=0) ) { $timezonul = "+".tzdelta() ;} else if (($timezonul == '99') AND (tzdelta()<0)) {$timezonul = tzdelta();} ...... , - .... Post title: face 2 face
Post description: Hello, if have around 1k students each year and using the f2f add-on. Our goal is to let those students to choose one session from 3 posibilities.  Does it mean that we will have to enter 1kX3 choices manually?? or can we add it with the excel some how? Tnx in advance Denia
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Moveing to face-2-face forum...
Comment 2: Not entirely sure what you're asking.  But I'll give it a shot.  If there are three sessions, each with a potential 333 people signed up for each of them, you'd only build 3 sessions.  I'm not sure what the other alternative would be. Example: I have as many as 5000 users at any given time (far more accounts at this point) and a few hundred classroom events (topics) going on each year.  Those users are eligible (mandated!) to attend specific topics in specific locations.  Each topic has a F2F section with all the available sessions people can sign up for...If we teach Sexual Harassment (don't do it) 10 times, and there are 250 staff who can sign up for the class, I create one activity with 10 sessions, each, in theory, accommodating 25 people. It is rarely that clean but that's sort of how it works. I've been told it is possible to csv sessions but it would be extremely time consuming and potentially dangerous.  I wouldn't.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Issues vs Discussions
Post description: Hi all, As you may be aware this plugin is sometimes supported and sometimes not. There are a few reasons for this and I am trying to rectify some of those as I go through things and sorry for the delays. One problem that the community of users can help me with is the way in which issues are being reported. At the moment there are many different threads being opened - here, in the plugin directory feedback, github, private messages to me etc - sometimes reporting the same issue or something that might be resolved within a different version. This means that it is difficult to track the exact issues and clearly identify where and when things should be corrected and to let the community know of updated code. I have switched off bug reporting on the github directory itself in the hopes that the Moodle tracker itself becomes the only place for issues to be reported. I'd like to also build a roadmap for coming versions and feature improvements so having all the issues in one place will really help this plan moving forward. There have been, since I took over maintenance, a few things I'd like to add and alter but first I need to get the current code into a consistent state. If you experience a issue please first check the tracker to see if there is an item already reporting this which you can add to and/or vote on and if not then please create a new one. The forums and plugin comments should ideally be used only for questions regarding general support such as configuration questions, suggestions for features and their related discussions and general use or feedback of the module. I will not be able to support bugs reported in these locations. In the meantime, thank you for your patience, Stacey

Post title: iCal timezone issue
Post description: Hello all, I am using Moodle 2.8.5+ (Build: 20150326) and Face to Face 2015021300.  We have come across an issue in which the timezone in iCal attachments is off by two hours for employees in our east coast offices (the server is located in the Mountain time zone).  No matter what changes I make to the server time zone or the user time zone I get this difference. I found this post https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=137974 and am wondering if this would resolve or at least temporarily fix this issue.  Any one else have any experience with this problem, if so how did you resolve it? Scott
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Scott, I had the same issue. What I did to fix this was to "enable timezones" in setting sessions up. Then we made sure that the users are all in their location timezones instead of UTC which are problematic. Maybe that will fix your issue. Regards, Miguel
Comment 2: Miguel, Thanks for responding.  I am not familiar with this setting, where is it? Scott

Post title: Is Face to Face temperamental
Post description: I have used F2F for some years and it worked always fine. However, in recent months it became unreliable and what makes it worse still is that it works randomly. Generally, I enter students into he waiting list and then later enter the course date.  Then F2F should send out the invitation and a reminder the day before the course. Sometimes, no invitations are sent out, even though I have received a confirmation. Other times it sends some invitations out but not all of them. Initially, we thought it could be the clients firewall, but it appears that clients receive some and some are going nowhere or into cyber space. It is difficult to judge, but it appears to me that it all started when we moved to a new server . We use Moodle 2.8.1 Would anyone have a suggestion?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: We haven't noticed problems using Moodle 2.7+, but we have several blocking plugins preventing us from jumping to 2.8, so we haven't done much testing yet. There were some changes in the messaging and events systems that might have impacted a module like F2F which hasn't been updated yet.
Comment 2: While I would say F2F is a little temperamental, this doesn't sound like a F2F problem, per se.  That sounds like something going wonky in the chron.  I don't know much about how the fiddly bits work but when chrons aren't running right, nothing runs right. Also, I'm not totally sure, but last I looked the most up to date F2F plugin was for 2.7...there were quite a few changes in 2.8...it might just not sync up entirely friendly?
Comment 3: Thanks for the replies and I have past on the information. Unfortunately, the problems persist. As always, I enter my students manually one by one and when we have a few, I schedule a date for a session and the emails should be sent to the students and the manager. The first session only one student was notified! The second session some students were notified, but not all! The next 12 sessions all students were notified but no manger email went out!
Comment 4: The problem has still not been resolved and cron was singled out. As I understand it, the problem has to do with the upgrade to Moodle 2.8 and that the F2F plugin has not been updated. It appears that it is not a priority of the developers. What a shame, as this plugin has worked very well in the past and is important to my operation. Does anyone knows another plugin that could be used instead? Should I revert to an older Moodle? Or is there anyone out there that has the ability to update the F2F plugin?

Forum Post: 
Post title: Face-to-face/Prerequisites
Post description: I have recently come across an interesting question and would love some feedback... We use the Face-to-face activity to allow learners to sign up for in person sessions and we also use prerequisites to track learner progress, etc. If we have multiple sessions available for one Face-to-face activity and the requirement for the course completion is a grade (attendance) in the face-to-face activity does it effect the course completion if they only sign up for one session? Or for the course completion to work properly with the prerequisities would they have to sign up for each session? Sorry if that is really confusing... Thank you in advance for your time and/or ideas!!
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: It is my understanding that a user CANNOT sign up for more than one session in the same face to face activity. That is a problem for us, but in your case might be desirable. You can test this by setting up more than one session for a face to face and see if the same student can sign up to multiple sessions. To accomplish this in our setting we have to set up separate face to face activities , each with its own sessions. Your bigger problem might be that F2F counts any attendance status (Fully attended, partially attended, no show) as being a valid completion. This is also a problem for us but I have not had time to look into the solution that the followup message to this thread offers: https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=225026
Comment 2: Hi Mia, Hmm - I think you and I seem to face the same challenges. My other answer to the above is - I have remmed out the lines that have partially attended or no show - if someone doesn't show, the facilitator actually removes them from the session. This way, they have to get a "Attended" to get a course completion. Obviously this may not work for everyone. Incidently, I have a cancellation report, which picks out students that have cancelled sessions and why, and when the person cancelling the session is not the student, puts it as a "No Show" Cheers Peter
Comment 3: yes I always read your face to face posts and it seems like we do have some of the same issues. Thanks for the info about the partially attended or no show -- we want to record no shows, though. We are working on a custom addition to Face to Face that adds another layer of approval after the manager approval so that an account number can be entered by a fund manager. In addition, the approval links that take the approvers to their approvals filter the approvals on the page so that only their own approvals show, AND the approver does not need the permission to the entire Attendees page if they use the link to access the approvals page. I hope that we can eventually get this code and some other code we are customizing in F2F incorporated into the main F2F module. Will tell more as it develops in case others are interested.
Comment 4: Hi all, I was searching for something completely different in Google, and this came up, which reminded me, I finally after 18 months found the root cause of the issue. By default, Moodle sets the default grade to pass as 0 (who knows why...) Once you change this default to 100, then any F2F activity created will have the no show, partial attendence etc marked as failed, rather than passed. I then also did a cheeky back end database to all F2F sessions to have the gradetopass setting set to 100. I hope this helps someone else. Cheers Peter
Comment 5: Thank you for your post, we have run into significant issues using the prerequisities for the face-to-face sessions and have decided to forego the use of prerequisites for this activity at this time but I will continue testing and let you know if I come across another alternative. Thank you for your time and have a wonderful day!

Post title: Remove entries from upcoming events?
Post description: Is there a way to remove face to face entries from the
upcoming events block? We use it in a hospital and the calendar gets
overloaded with face to face entries, since we schedule small blocks of time multiple times per day. Would be nice to remove them from the calendar view as well...
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Nathan
You can turn off calendar entries by editing your face-to-face activity. Go to your face to face activity and click on it. THis should bring up your Facetoface administration settings then select "edit settings". Under "Calendar options" remove the tick next to "show on the calendar". Hopefully this is what your after. Cheers

Forum Post: 
Post title: You are currently not assigned to a manager
Post description: I am a newbie of this module, and very confused. I did set the sessions and the roles (teacher and students, I couldn't find a manager role to assign), but if someone tries to enroll (even myself), get the message " You are currently not assigned to a manager in the system. Please contact the site administrator. ! Of course I am the administrator, but I couldn't find the answer in the documentation. The FAQ says "Starting with the Moodle 1.9 version of the Face-to-face module, a custom field called "Manager's email" is added to the user profile page". But I don't see it in the user profile (I mean the one under site administration). Furthermore, adding the address to each student manually seems very cumbersome! So I guess there should be another way: is there a step-by-step guide? The only place to insert an email seems to be in the module settings "sender address", (as the sender should be the manger, I guess), but it doesn't work. There is a section "Manager emails" on the same page, but I couldn't understand those settings, particularly "Ask users for their manager's email address." confused me. Should the student set their own manager's address? Could I be driven to some documentation that explain these issues, maybe starting from what a manager is and why should be different from the teacher? Thanks in advance for your patience
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Piersante Once you setup Face2face every user will need to go into their individual user profile and enter an email address of their manager or a person who will approve their enrolment.  This is a must. The Face2face add-on uses a two-tier approval process. The first tier is the manager. Once the user sets their managers email address, they can go to a course and enrol. Upon their enrolment an email will be sent to their manager. The email will contacin a link for the manager to login and approve the enrolment. Once the manager has approved the enrolment, an email will be sent to the course coordinator /s. The course cordinator is anyone who has been given teacher or manager role within the course. You need to set these roles for every course. To approve the enrolment as a course coordinator, the person who has been allocated teacher or manager role for the course will log in and go to Site pages (left had side under home) and select Course coordinator approval. This is where the lis of students who have been approved to attend will show up for the course coordintor to approve to attend the course. Once the course coordinator approves the student, this completes the process. Please remember to set your course to use the Face2face add-on. Go to the course and under Users > Enrollment methods select Enrol Approval and move that to the top of the list (select the blue arrow). I normall delete the "Self enrolment (student)" if that is on the list. If it is grey out you dont need to worry. Manaul enrolments is normally at the bottom when using the Face2face add-on. You now need to set up your Face2face add-on by adding an activity. Go into the course, make sure editing is on and on the first topic you need to add a activity. Find the Face-to-face activity and select Add. You must add a name. I suggest you type in the name of the course as this will show up on the 2 emails as part of the enrolment process. You must check the following boxes: Approval required. Send notice to manager (confirmation message) Send notice to manager (Reminder message) Send notice to manager (Cancellation message) Click on Save and return to course Get a normal user with only student role to find the course and see is it asks you to enrol and put a justification in. Hope this helps Peter
Comment 2: Thanks a lot. Very clear and enlighting. The only information that was missing is that you must create an user field in the user profile and populate it with the manager email for each student, This is very different from what the FAQ say, as they suggest that the field is already there. Not only this was not clear from the documentation, but it is cumbersome, as the default manager address is only inherited by new (or updated) users. I had to open and save all the students profiles one by one, to let them to get it (I suspect that I could have added the email address to the data user field table directly in the database , but I didn't dare to try). I find it also illogical, as the manager would usually belong to the activity rather than to the students (students might have different facetoface activities , each with a different manager), so one would expect it to be defined in the session properties, rather than globally. Nevertheless, thanks to your note I was qickly able to put the module at work and I find it wonderful and very flexible. I now have one more question: the confirmation email has fields for venue, room and location, which in my case are empty. Where do you set them? thanks, piersante
Comment 3: "I now have one more question: the confirmation email has fields for venue, room and location, which in my case are empty. Where do you set them?" They are set as added custom fields in the settings for the face to face plugin: Site administration / Plugins / Activity modules / Face To Face Section - Custom Session Fields Create a new field for each of the 3 fields Note: I think the  short names need to be 'venue', 'location',  'room' - all lowercase. You can use capitals in the Name field.
Comment 4: Hello Where should the manager's email address field be created, and what is its short name? TIA John
Comment 5: Hi John To create the manager's email address field : Go to: 1. Site administration  / ► Users/ ► Accounts/ ► User profile fields 2. When there select   "create new profile field” 3. Complete the settings for your new field: Common Settings: - Short name (must be unique): managersemail - Name: whatevername - Description: whatever ..... - Various Parameters : ... Specific Settings - Default value etc When done Click on Save Changes So the managers email must be created in the User Profile under Site administration. The shortname  = managersemail. Hope this is helpfull.
Comment 6: Thanks perfect.

Post title: Prevent students cancelling bookings
Post description: Hi, The face-to-face module looks perfect for us except for one feature, we need to be able to prevent users from cancelling a session once they've booked on to it. I've had a look through the settings and permissions but can't spot a way to do it. Is there any way to do this without having to meddle with the PHP? (using a hosted moodle so I don't have access to the php files). If it's not already possible could I request it as a future feature? Thank you, Helen
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: I would love for this feature to be added!
Comment 2: Helen, I have actually implemented something a little similar to what you are wanting in the form of not allowing students to cancel once the start time for the item ( lesson in our case) they have registered is within 2 hours or less. I hard coded it into the module instead of making the feature selectable because I was in a hurry and am not a pro at PHP. Nevertheless, as a result of poking around in the code, I do know where the lines are that simply need to be commented out if you only want to remove the ability to cancel. But, you said you don't have access to the php files right...? I don't think it would be that hard to simply add a toggle/tick box that allows for canceling or no canceling. If I get some time I'll work with it a little and if I actually managed to get something working I will offer it to Alastair who I think is the current maintainer. Regards Jason
Comment 3: Hi Jason, Your toggle/tick box for cancelling or no cancelling is exactly what I'm after. It would be fantastic if you could get it added to the face-to-face activity. Sorry for the very slow reply, I'd forgotten to tell moodle to email me if someone replied. Hopefully, Helen
Comment 4: Helen, My apologies for not seeing this and responding sooner. Since this post I have modified Face to face quite a bit more and am hoping to be able to soon provide the code to the maintainer in the hopes that she can merge the features I have added with the current version. I hope to be able to make this request by the end of this month (March) so hopefully the feature you are seeking will be included in the near future. Regards Jason

Post title: Backup without user data
Post description: Guys, We have come across a small issue, when we back up a course not saving user data, the other thing that goes missing is the session information for the course. (Actually, anything which is held in the mdl_facetoface_session_data). However, if you do the backup with user data, and restore without user data, then it works. The issue is within the backup_facetoface_stepslib.php - line 128 $session_data_element->set_source_table('facetoface_session_data', array('sessionid' => backup::VAR_PARENTID)); which does the back up of the data only if user data is selected. I would recommend it be removed out of the user backup section and place it in the data backup section. (I moved it to line 121 before the line if ($userinfo) { This allows things like location to be backed up without user data. Cheers Peter

Post title: Email Display in Add/remove Attendees
Post description: Hi, I have stumbled across an interesting one. As an administrator, I get the emails of students next to their name when signing up, as per below. However, as any other role, I don't get them. However when I go to sign a user up to the course, I can see them there. Cheers Peter
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Peter, I am wondering if you ever managed to figure this problem out? I am currently dealing with the same issue (sort of). When logged in as admin I can search using values stored in the idnumber field when adding attendees (I have enabled that field in the show user identity setting) but when I log in as a teacher or manager the search only looks at the users first and last name. I've poked around in the code for hours and am starting to get bug eyed. Just wondering if you might have figured this issue out? Jason
Comment 2: Hi Jason, The person looking has to be a member of a site wide role, which has the attribute moodle/site:viewuseridentity set on it. Even that role on a course does not work - has to be site wide. Cheers Peter

Forum Post: 
Post title: Upgrading facetoface from 2007091300 to 2013010400
Post description: Hi, I'm in the process of upgrading from Moodle 1.9.19 to 2.2.6 (I realise these are ageing versions with limited-to-no support) which involved upgrading facetoface from 2007091300 to 2013010400 and there were multiple issues. To resolve these I had to make changes to mod/facetoface/db/upgrade.php, I've attached the patch to this post. To summarise the issues: $dbman->add_field(), create_table() and drop_field() appears to return void so don't assign this to $result. (This appears to be already known: https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=217299 ). $OUTPUT->notification() is an empty object, add $OUTPUT to the list of globals at the start of xmldb_facetoface_upgrade(). Property $DB->debug isn't accessible (protected) so remove these. The second parameter for $DB->get_records() should be either null or an array. The field list for $DB->get_records() should be in the fourth parameter. Unless of course there's something very wrong with my installation. All the best, Leon
