Forum Post: 
Post title: Wait listed sessions
Post description: Francois I noticed in the options for the f2f module that you can send a wait list message. How do I setup a wait listed f2f session? Currently when I create a session and fill the booking it removes it from the available sessions list and tells me the booking is full. Scott Karren
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Scott, What we mean by wait-listed session is slightly different than what you have in mind I think. A 'wait-listed session' in the Face-to-face module is a session for which no date is currently set. Users can then register their interest in attending a Face-to-face course even if it's not offered at this time. There is no way at this time to "exceed" the capacity of a given session but this can be approximated by adding a second session without a date on which users can sign-up if the other one is full.
Comment 2: Francois Thank you for the clarification. So if a user signs up for a 'wait-listed session' as you have described above what happens if a booking opens up in a non-wait-listed session? Can users be moved automatically from a wait-listed session to a non-wait-listed session? What would the process be in this case? Scott Karren
Comment 3: No, at the moment, the two sessions (the scheduled one and the wait-listed one) are completely separate. Thus the wait-list cannot be used to fill the spots of the people who cancel, unless the instructor manually adds them, or if they come back to the page by chance and see that a spot has freed up. It would probably be a good idea to implement something like that though. I'd have to think about how to do this while keeping the UI as simple as possible. If you have any ideas, I suggest that you create a new ticket in the tracker and describe how you see it working. Cheers, Francois
Comment 4: Thanks for the reply. I have added CONTRIB-408 to the tracker. Scott Karren
Comment 5: I'm using the latest version of face to face in moodle 2.5 and the waitlist functionality seems to have no effect at all. Whether Allow overbooking is set to on or off, the session can be overbooked and no waitlist messages ever go out. Does anyone use this feature? It seems like the following tracker implemented a waitlist feature but it is not working for me: https://tracker.moodle.org/browse/CONTRIB-408?page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:changehistory-tabpanel#issue-tabs

Forum Post: 
Post title: F2F "No Show" Bug / Feature?
Post description: OK - combining F2F with Activity Tracker, and we came across a curious instance where if a student was marked as a No Show in the Face to Face session, they were showing as successully completed the module. Of course, as I have customised both, I went back to basics to find it, and here is what I found. Regardless of the result of the Face to Face session, (Fully attended, partially attended, no show) Face to Face still injects a completion status of 1 into the table mdl_course_modules_completion . (Note - if course completion is set to require 100% to pass, this is not an issue - just reporting through Activity Tracker, which utilises the completionstatus flag in mdl_course_modules_completion ) Now one could argue either way for this - that they technically have completed the module, however got a pass mark of 0%, or they have not completed the module because they didn't turn up. Myself - I argue the second option - but interesting to see other thoughts out there. Any one with thoughts? Cheers Peter
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Actually, after a bit more work and investigating - it is not the F2F as such. By default with course completion, any grade is enough to complete. If you then go into grades, Grade Administration->Categories and items->Full View , then set the "Grade to Pass" to be higher than 0.(probably 100)  This then injects a 2 for a pass, or a 3 for a fail into the mdl_course_modules_completion module, and then need to modify the Activity Tracking to look for just a 1 or a 2, not anything that is inserted into the field. Simple when you know how????? Cheers Peter
Comment 2: We don't make use of partial attendance or no show.  If we did use no show, I would NOT want it to indicate that the activity has been completed under Completion Tracking. Thanks for sharing your workaround.  Looks a bit complicated to me though.  I think it'll be easier for us if I just remove the option to select partial attendance or no show to prevent teachers from selecting those options. If we were to use "No show" on our system, I would want it to allow users to re-book another session. As it is now, students can only book one session of a Face-to-face activity.  If they're not able to attend the session for whatever reason, how do I let them book another time instead.  I'm still not so sure how to handle this properly.
Comment 3: This did end up complex for us, and screwed with a few other things. So - in the back end, I remmed out the No Show and Partially Completed so the only thing that can be completed is Attended. If the student is a No Show, then the facilitator removes them from the session. In this way, they are not marked as completed, but they are also not prevented from booking into another session. I also have a report that displays reasons for cancelled sessions, and if the user that cancels the session isn't the student, then it reports as a no show. I hope that makes sense. Cheers Peter
Comment 4: Yes, it does make sense and it helps.  Thanks! I wish the teacher/facilitator didn't have to manually remove the no shows but I guess it needs to be done.
Comment 5: Peter, Thank you for sharing the information regarding this bug and your workaround. May I ask what ended up happening with the workaround? Which issues did you run into? In our case, we want to use the functionality of "No Shows" and "Partially Completed", but of course it has to function correctly. Thank you for sharing!

Forum Post: 
Post title: F2F - Manager Approval Issue
Post description: Hi Alastair , I found an interesting bug today.... A F2F course requires manager approval, and a user signs up to the course. An email is sent to the manager, and the student - all is good. However, the student is not given an indication on the screen that they are waitlisted, so they can sign in again. The big gotcha, is once they sign in a second time, even once they are approved and the status as an admin says booked, the end user still has the status as being able to sign up. They will NEVER see on their screen that they are booked in - they will always get the option to sign up. Of course, if they sign up again AFTER they are approved, then they get un-booked and put as waiting for approval, and the whole cycle starts again. Any thoughts? This is latest iteration of F2F and moodle 2.4.3+ (Dated this week) Cheers Peter
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Actually, ignore this - I found the issue. (My meddling, not yours - my apologies) Ended up because I removed the no show (due to other reasons) by remming the line define('MDL_F2F_STATUS_NO_SHOW',            80); it inadvertantly caused an issue further down, where it would not ever show the person as having been booked in to attend the session. Cheers Peter

Forum Post: 
Post title: F2F Report bug
Post description: Hi Alastair, We had our big launch, and of course a few days before had staff madly adding Face to Face sessions (a few hundred) We were going through the logs and kept finding these seamlessly random students have added a F2F session - needless to say we were incredibly confused. After some chasing, we have found that F2F was injecting into the mdl_log database , and for some reason using the activityid as the userid - hence why we were getting random students in the log... (Including students that had never logged in) I found that line 209 in sessions.php seems to be the culprit add_to_log($course->id, 'facetoface', 'added session', 'facetoface', 'sessions.php?f='.$facetoface->id, $facetoface->id, $cm->id); My suggested correction is add_to_log($course->id, 'facetoface', 'added session',  'sessions.php?f='.$facetoface->id, $facetoface->id, $cm->id); Let me know if you want me to raise a tracker for this? (I haven't done one before.... could be interesting) Cheers Peter

Post title: You are not currently assigned to a manager in the system. Please contact the site administrator error
Post description: Hi, I am having this error 'You are not currently assigned to a manager in the system. Please contact the site administrator error' when a student tries to book on a course. Currently, the students doesn't have a manager assigned as we don't want manager approval. Anyone have any ideas?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Jes, There is a check box on the Facetoface activity settings screen called "Require approval" if you uncheck this then manager approval will not be required. Cheers, Alastair
Comment 2: Dear Alastair, I don't have this box checked, No approval required, but get this warning anyway. What else can I do to make it work? I have Moodle 2.4. Thanks, Isabelle
Comment 3: Hi Isabelle, Do you have the 'Send notice to manager' checkbox ticked below the default text for the emails? I had to untick the box and it worked. I didn't receive the error after that. Hope this helps. Regards, Jes
Comment 4: Hi,Thanks for your swift answer. I unchecked all the notice to manager boxes and that indeed did the trick. I can sign up now. But now I wonder, where do I assign a manager? Do the teachers get the notices automatically? It would be great if you could assign a manager per session. In my situation sessions are facilitated by different people who would like to keep track of their participants. I can't find a setting for assigning a manager. (Will scan this forum of course.) And yes, found it. You need to make a profilefield with managersemail and then it works! Bye, Isabelle

Comment 2: Hi Flottter, I am having trouble reproducing this bug. I have tested it on both a fresh install of Moodle 2.3.1 and an upgraded Moodle 2.3.1 and have been unable to reproduce the bug. Would you be able to turn on debugging and get some more information? and also tell me when exactly it appears. Does it happen when you click the add session button or when you click the "Save changes" button after entering details? It would be also be helpful to know if you have any custom fields and which settings you have chosen for the session. Thanks, Alastair
Comment 3: Hi Alastair, this is the debug message: Notice : Undefined variable: params in /public_html/testserver/mod/facetoface/lib.php on line 3619 It hapens when I click the lnk "Add a new session" Some additional info: PHP Version 5.3.16 5.5.24.55 Cheers, Flotter
Comment 4: Hi Alastair, I have had a similar issue but used a suggestion from an earlier posting as a work around... In the site admin settings I unselected the "Session role" where it indicated "student". I was then able to add sessions including the 3 custom fields that I have set up. Having tested it a bit I can get the student grades to flow through to the grades book; manually add and remove students and take attendance as intended. Apart from unselecting the site role it seems to work well for me. Cheers Mark
Comment 5: Hi, I'm new on here and in moodle development in general. on moodle 2.3.2 I found a bug in your old and new release, which gave me empty editor field when i wanted to edit session details, even tho database was updated. long story short, on line 210 " $toform->details = $session->details;" should be "$toform->details['text'] = $session->details;" after I did that I was able to edit session details. Comment 6: Hi Dennis, Meant to reply with a thank you - confirmed the bug in our system and patched it. :D Nice work. Cheers Peter
Comment 7: Dennis Thanks for the fix, works perfectly. Just to let others know it is in the sessions.php file Cheers Richard
Comment 8: Hi Alastair, my problem is, that the event/session dates are shown as global dates in the calendar, not as course dates. So our calendar is overcrowded with thousends of session dates. Is there a workaround to solve this problem?
Comment 9: I'm wondering this myself. The sessions all show up in ALL courses upcoming events block. It would be nice if they just showed up in activities 's course cal.
Comment 10: Hi, The same issue existed on 1.9 version - http://tracker.moodle.org/browse/CONTRIB-2850 - but I thought this was changed to display a course based activity for calendar, but could also write to the global calendar. I've not yet used f2f on our 2.3 site - but was about to update today when I read through the forums. This would be a real pain on an otherwise great tool.
Comment 11: Hi Gordon,

In our case, an F2F activity allows us to schedule our courses in various cities around the country.

If the sessions did not display on the global events calendar, we would have to create them manually, so that our customers would still be able to view these upcoming classes regardless of whether or not they were enrolled in the course or even registered on the site.

This change would considerably diminish the value of the F2F module to us.

I understand how important it must be for other users of the module to have the sessions viewable as a course level event, Perhaps a setup option where you could choose to display the session as either a global or course event would work.

Regards,

Jenna
Comment 12: Hi All, Just thought I'd let people know that there is some work in progress to increase the configurability of the calendar events. Hopefully once that is done it will work for a lot more possible situations and be much more flexible. Cheers, Alastair
Comment 13: Hi Alistair, Great to hear it. Jenna - I agree that there are different use cases - it's the ability to make it configurable as either/or that's important. When you've got 40+ courses using the block having all sessions display globally becomes a negative as users get swamped with upcoming events - but I certainly see uses for being able to display a session globally to alert all users (eg drop-in sessions). Regards, Gordon.
Comment 14: Hi, Is there any update on this?  I, too, would like to be able to set F2F sessions as course events rather than global events. Thanks, Aylwin

Forum Post: 
Post title: Is it possible to repair face-to-face upgrade error?
Post description: Greetings! I have been happily using a 1.9 version of moodle with face-to-face for about 4 years, and decided to attempt an upgrade to v2.3.   As per the upgrade documentation, that required going to v2.2 first. Unfortunately, the upgrade failed for the Face-to-Face module, with this error: mod_facetoface Field "shortname" already exists Stack trace: * line 573 of /lib/ddl/database_manager.php: ddl_exception thrown * line 141 of /mod/facetoface/db/upgrade.php: call to database_manager->add_field() * line 540 of /lib/upgradelib.php: call to xmldb_facetoface_upgrade() * line 271 of /lib/upgradelib.php: call to upgrade_plugins_modules() * line 1437 of /lib/upgradelib.php: call to upgrade_plugins() * line 269 of /admin/index.php: call to upgrade_noncore() I removed the module and continued with the upgrade, which succeeded, and then attempted to add the face-to-face module again, but continue to get the same error. Is there a way to recover from this? The " Server Checks" page says that everything is ok.  I'm running PHP ver 5.3.8 and mysql ver 5.1.65.14.0.    I installed moodle ver 2.2.6 (planning to then upgrade to ver 2.3). Thanks for any assistance. -- Steve Messinger
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Steve, You should be able to fix this problem by changing the following line in mod/facetoface/db/upgrade.php about line 141: $result = $result && $dbman->add_field($table, $field1); needs to be changed to if (!$dbman->field_exists($table, $field)) { $dbman->add_field($table, $field1); } Hopefully after that has been changed the upgrade will work without breaking. Cheers, Alastair
Comment 2: Hi Alastair, 1st thank you for your time.  I'm also getting the same error when trying to upgrade to facetoface 2.2+. I tried the code change you're recommending above but got a different error message.  Here it is.. mod_facetoface Notice: Undefined variable: field in /home/cooptraining/dev/mod/facetoface/db/upgrade.php on line 141 Fatal error: Call to a member function getName() on a non-object in /home/cooptraining/dev/lib/ddl/database_manager.php on line 153 Version I'm using: Moodle 2.2.6 (Build: 20121112) My SQL : 5.0.92-log PHP: 5.3.18 Thanks, Pierre
Comment 3: Hi Pierre, Sorry it took so long to reply. I noticed a problem with the post I put up with the fix. On the first line where is says "$field" it should be "$field1". Hopefully once that is done it should work ok. Cheers, Alastair

Post description: Can someone give me the code to allow facetoface to allow and show multiple signups from one person?
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Tiffany, Multiple signups of the same person in the same session (why) or multiple signups of the same person in multiple sessions of the same activity? To the best of my knowledge multiple signups of the same person in multiple sessions of the same activity does not exist,  although there has been some discussion on this topic. You might consider creating multiple copies of the same activity with differrent dates or create a session with multiple dates and times. What is your objective?  ie what use case do you need to satisfy? Jenna
Comment 2: We want manager to sign up for an ongoing community event. The even will happen every Monday in 2013 and we want each manager to sign up multiple times until all the slots are taken.
Comment 3: A. Do you want each Manager to book and attend each Monday session throughout 2013? OR B. Do you want them to book individual sessions because you can not accomodate everyone each Monday? If A, then create one activity with one session containing multiple dates (every Monday) and have them book that event.; If B and its first come first serve, then you would have to create an activity for each Monday session throughout the year.  Again, you will find some discussion on signing up for multiple sessions in the same activity, but I'm not sure that anyone has enabled this in a recent release with custom code.  It's definitely not doable with the current release. Jenna

Post title: Facetoface 2.2.2 Released

It contains a number of fixes including the "Expect 1, got 0" issues that a number of people have been experiencing. https://moodle.org/plugins/pluginversions.php?plugin=mod_facetoface Here is a full list of the changes/fixes: Bug fixes: - Prevent direct access to conditional activities - Ensure site calendar is updated when activity is updated - Fix hardcoded language string in attendees.php - Make sure notices are sent from email specified in settings - Fix fatal error when deleting data from custom session field - Fix display of images in facetoface description - Stop error being thrown when creating session Improvements: - Create new iCal UID for every session re-signup Cheers, Alastair

Forum Post: 
Post title: Security Risk Version 1.9  ???
Post description: Our service provided indicated that when they tested Face-to-Face Module they identified a major security risk (hole) and alerted us that Face-to-Face Module was not safe to run/install.  We are running Moodle 1.9.11.  Could anyone shed some light on this?  Is there a fix?  This module does exactly what we need and we would like to use it.  Thanks!
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Glen, The feed back from your hosting provider which i have also received from them is as follows; "editattendees.php uses PARAM_RAW for a search string used to search the database . This is a serious SQL injection vulnerability. (this issue also exists in the 1.9 version". i have no idea how potentially serious this is, but do know that other hosting providers don't seem to be so concerned about it. Jenna
Comment 2: Hi Glen and Jenna, Although PARAM_RAW is used, the data is still escaped by Moodle so will not result in an SQL injection vulnerability, nor is the search string stored or displayed to the user so will not result in a XSS vulnerability either. In short this does not appear to be exploitable, however the user of PARAM_RAW is still less than ideal so I have updated the f2f module to use a more restrictive param type - this should keep your hosting company happy. Cheers, Alastair
Comment 3: The latest code in the git repo at https://github.com/totara/facetoface-1.9 has the fix in. I'll get a packaged release out tomorrow that will include this patch. Cheers, Alastair
Comment 4: Thank you Alastair.  This will be very helpful for organizations using Remote-Learner as a hosting provider in the US.  Will you be able to make the same mod to the current 2.0 code? Regads, Jenna
Comment 5: Hi Jenna, Unfortunately I can't update the 2.0 version as it is hosted on a github account that I don't have access to. I could issue a pull request but noticed there has been one sitting there since the 31th of October that still hasn't been accepted so I'm not sure if they are being actively looked at. I will however message Jeremy Schweitzer and see if he can get it updated. Cheers, Alastair
Comment 6: Jenna, Alastair reached out to us and I think we've fixed this security issue in our 2.0 code. You can check it out here: https://github.com/mynameisdongyoung
Comment 7: Very much appreciated.  Thank you Jeremy and Alastair. Jenna
Comment 8: Yes.  Thank You very much Jeremy and Alastair.  Our service provider (Remote Learner) got the fix and certified it for use.  We are thrilled to be able to use this Module.  Thank You for your responsiveness and help. Much appreciated. -Glen

Forum Post: 
Post title: Attendance Does Not Save
Post description: Has anyone experienced a problem where the attendance check boxes will not save after you have checked the attended class check box and selected 'save attendance'? I'm having an issue where this information will not save. Any information would be greatly appreciated... Thanks, Joe Nemeth
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Joe, The first two things I would do to try to figure out what is happening is to turn on full debugging in Moodle: 1- Set " Server | Debugging | Debug messages" to "Developer" 2- Set "Server | Debugging | Display debug messages" to "Yes" Then have a look at the error log of your webserver. For example, on a Debian system running Apache , that's /var/log/apache2/error_log Also, another thing to check would be your version of PHP. Are you running PHP4 or PHP5? (you can find that from "Server | PHP info"
Comment 2: Hi Joe, Have you ever found a solution for your issue? I know it's been a long time but I'm having the same issues right now and trying to figure out a solution. Regards, Pierre

Forum Post: 
Post title: Calendar
Post description: Hi all, Face-to-face will be great for our institution but one issue is the Moodle calandar entry is SITE WIDE. This is not good for us. We need the calandar entry to be Course wide, as we have many different departments / courses using our single install of moodle. As it is, awards, programmes and courses will all have calendar entrys that do not apply to them. Does anyone have a soloution to this? We use Moodle 1.9.7 Many Thanks John
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: I'll add +1 to this and have raised a bug report in the tracker for this specific issue if you'd like to vote - http://tracker.moodle.org/browse/CONTRIB-2850 If events are course based they must be targeted at individuals on that course, not displayed on the site-wide calendar where they just confuse everyone else. Thanks, Gordon.
Comment 2: This isn't a bug  - you can disable this behavior under the Face-to-face options by unchecking "Show on the calendar". If you want it to show up on the course calendar you can either add it manually or wait for people to sign up and then it will appear on their own calendars.
Comment 3: I disagree - perhaps it's terminology semantics about what a bug is. Would you be happier if it was called a usability flaw? I have tutors starting to use this actively so the global calendar is getting overwhelmed with course specific content. The default setting is to show on calendar, and if you're co-ordinating training sessions that sounds like the right thing to do. The tick box option can't be disabled by the administrator without hacking the code. If the calendar populated was the course one instead of the site calendar it wouldn't be an issue. After testing this I've also found that if someone saves the event with those default settings then edits to uncheck the calendar box the events remain visible in the global calendar (I'd call that a bug too).
Comment 4: I still wouldn't call this behavior a bug. This is the exact behavior that plenty of people need, so a whole sale change to course specific context would be a regression for us. I see you added this request to the tracker, but I disagree with your characterization. Instead, a new feature request to add the ability to choose the context would more appropriate. I'd also say that the other two complaints are best served by feature requests as neither are technically a bug. A bug is when something doesn't function the way it was intended, in this case each function behaves exactly the way it was designed and are perfectly usable for many scenarios. However, I would agree that adding a way to set the global default for whether an event appears on the calendar or not and an easy way to remove events from the calendar would be useful new features.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Updated invite not sent when a F2F is updated
Post description: Hi there -  I noticed today that an updated invite is not sent to attendees when I update the time or date of a face-to-face event. This creates a problem! How do you handle updating an f2f event? Is the best practice to cancel the original event instead and create a new one? Wouldn't the user then have to delete the old event from their calendar? Your tips and ideas are appreciate! Thanks, Kymm
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: This is a workaround I use, the order of actions is important: Export the participants' list for the session (to excel for instance) Use add/remove participants for the session to remove all participants (this send the cancellation emails for the previous session dates) Change the session dates to the new ones Use add/remove participants to add participants 1 by 1 - this sends the new updated invitations to them. I use the exported list form step 1 to search the participants that were already signed up. Regards, Amir

So if you have some special instructions that apply to a particular session or group of sessions you can use it to inform the attendees. Apparently the notice appears in the new version of the face-to-face block (not yet on moodle.org but available here: http://git.catalyst.net.nz/gw?p=blocks-facetoface.git;a=summary ). > Currently they can only be defined as one phrase. In a multi-lingual site this may be > problematic as different users using different languages may need to see different translations >of the field. This is a difficult issue, because at the moment there is no way to add new language strings using the language string editor, so if you create a new custom field there's no way to create a language string for it. The session custom fields is based off the User profile fields code, so presumably this is also a problem for user custom fields too? Simon

Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: I'm not sure what you mean by synchronous, but the best way to describe the face-to-face module is as a booking and attendance system for meetings or training sessions that occur outside moodle (i.e. real-life training rather than online). The main help page is here: http://docs.moodle.org/en/Face-to-face_module Which includes this page that gives a walk-through of the features available: http://docs.moodle.org/en/Face-to-face_walk_through
Comment 2: No, it is for using Moodle to schedule face-to-face sessions in the real world. The only Synchronous bit build into Moodle is the Chat module.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Activity Locking vs Using a Child Course
Post description: Our courses consist of blended learning. Right now we have two moodle courses set up for each course. One course is for the live instruction portion for which we use face to face. The second is for the online learning content where we have uploaded scorm content. The course is sequential meaning that the online content does not become available until the user completes the live instruction course. I tried using Activity Locking (I'm don't fully understand all of its features yet) but the problems I have are two fold: 1 - We run the same live instruction course in dozens of cities. Each instance/session is its own face-to-face and a user need only attend one face to face session to be eligible for the online content. It seems as if the activity lock is an all or nothing proposition, I can't set it to say that any face-to-face attendance would qualify to unlock the online learning content. 2 - The online learning content is accessible for 60 days from the face-to-face/live session attendance. Any ideas on how to control this? Right now we do this manually. Thank you
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Jon. As for issue one if you open just one face-to-face activity but then open different sessions for that activity (these can be on different times and in different locations) this should solve your problem. Actually, I think this should be the correct use of this activity. The only times we open more than one face-to-face activity, is when there is a significant difference between the two - e.g. begineer vs. advanced intructor-led training. I have an idea concerning issue 2. If you use groups and groupings, you can then put the online content (SCORM) to be visible only to a specific grouping , and then define the availability of this resource/activity according to when the group had the training. So, if you put copies of the SCORM activity in the course, only the group members would see it according to the availability setting set within the actvity. Using groups/groupings would also prove valuable to track the grades and completion of activities per group. You can distribute the people in the groups or perhaps better yet - avoiding manual work - give each group a unique key for course enrolment and they are then automatically put into their group. One more thing - is there a specific reason you put the online and face-to-face activities in different courses? Wouldn't it be easier for learners if you put it in the same course - say in topic 1 and topic 2? Best of luck. Ask more if I was not clear.

Post description: I am currently using Moodle v.1.9.4. When signing up for a face-to-face session, the user has the option to be notified by: Email ical attachment Or both The issue I am having is if the user selects the both, or ical attachment (which is what our suggested option would be) the email comes through fine, however, the attachment shows as File type: Outlook Item File Size: 636 bytes If you click on the attachment it opens up a blank message in MS Outlook. I don't belive that the problem is on MS Exchange end becasue I can export and import a calendar from Moodle into Outlook as an ical attachment without a problem. Any suggestions/solutions would be greatly appreciated. Thank you.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: I suspect that there might be something in the iCal files sent by the Face-to-face module that Outlook doesn't recognise.

Comment 3: Does anyone else out there have this issue? If so can you let me know what you did to fix it. Thanks, BH
Comment 4: Hi BH, In order to debug this problem, here's what I would do: 1- Get an email from the Face-to-face module with an ical attachment and save it to a file. 2- Compare the format of it with iCalendar files sent from Outlook (I have attached the one you sent me to this message). 3- Try to format the Face-to-face iCalendar files the same way such that Outlook will recognise them. Let me know if you find anything! Cheers, Francois

Forum Post: 
Post title: Confirmation emails : how to delay & trigger the sending ?
Post description: Hello, I am looking for an easy way to delay the sending of confirmation email in the face to face module. On my sandbox environment, the email is sent immediately after I assign an attendee to the session, which can cause problem if I select the wrong person in the list for example. I would like to explore different ways: - either having a confirmation button before sending the confirmation email (kind of approving the attendee's list, that would send the email to the whole list at one time) - or be able to setup a number of days before the session date to send the email for ex. 7 days before (my session events are often de-scheduled ans re-scheduled so I do not want to pollute users mailbox for nothing). This feature could also be used for reminder emails some days before the session. I have seen we can disable the email confirmation. If I do so and enable it while having already a list of attendees, what happens ? can we then send the confirmation mail to the list ?? Did anyone already developped something on this subject ? Feedbacks appreciated. Thanks for your help Sandrine
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Sandrine, If you use the teacher view (from the attendees list) to add/remove students to a Face-to-face session, then you can click the optional checkbox which allows you to suppress the email notifications before you add/remove attendees. That way if you need to add a bunch of people tentatively, you can click the checkbox and they won't hear about it under the reminder email comes in (which you can configure in the activity settings). If you need to remove them from the course before the reminder is sent out, then you can do so from the same page. As long as you click the checkbox before removing them, they will not receive an email. Cheers, Francois
Comment 2: Thanks François, Ive been trying what you've suggested, but I face 2 issues: - If I check the checkbox, then the confirmation mail is not sent to the attendees, but they receive anyway an email welcoming them to the course  such as: ' Welcome to 14 - Booking & Autofreighting! /a>' http://10.0.230.19/user/view.php?id=218&course=6 If you have not done so already, you should edit your profile page so that we can learn more about you: Is this linked to the fact that my course was not allowed to guest user ? If yes, what triggers this email and how can I cutomiez it ? would the workaround be to open the course to guest and what would be the consequences ? - If I follow your tip, then the user will only receive the remider message, and no confirmation message, right ? If I want to have both (i.e. a confirmation message when I decide and a reminder message at a predefined date before the session date, then I need to customize the confirmation mail feature, right ?
Comment 3: Hi Sandrine, That second email you mention "Welcome to Course Name" is not actually coming from the Face-to-face module. Instead, it's coming from:
Comment 4: HI François, Thanks for these details. Regarding your tips, I thought about it, but since I wish to map my users's list to the company Active Directory, which contains about 18.000 names, it is a bit tricky to find the right name to enroll to the session. Is there a known way to do a 'cut & paste' action with the attendee list ? Cheers, Sandrine
Comment 5: Not easily. I think that the cleanest solution to your problem would be to introduce the idea of active/inactive sessions. You could create a sesion which would be inactive (i.e. hidden from users) until you are ready to announce it. Confirmation emails would then get delayed until the session is active. Does that sound like it would solve your problem? Cheers, Francois
Comment 6: Thanks François. Indeed introducing a status (such as planned, open to enrollment, confirmed (means I have enough students to maintaint the session for example), cancelled, deferred) to the session could even enable more possibilities.. I'll think about it Cheers, Sandrine

Post description: Let me start off by explaining the situation. I don't want to have them automatically enrolled in the online course after they attend the face-to-face so the current external enrollment modules won't work for me. Post title: Duration variable issue
Post description: Admin just installed F2F. Using the F2F gui to set a session to be for example between 3:00 and 3:30 results in F2F messaging producing a substitution as follows... Template-> Duration: [duration] Result-> Duration 20 hours I have not looked at the code, but does it do substraction in a time base (i.e. from 3:20 to 4:40 would be 1 hr 20 mins, (or less optimally, 80 mins) or does it try to do things decimally as in 1.33333333333333333333333 hours which seems a bit silly.... and in either case why would "hours" be used but the number fo minutes unless there was a bug....
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: OK, I looked over the code briefly.... It looks like duration is stored as a decimal hour (stange, no? why introduce a decimal when the number of minutes is an integer value) so this finds the decimal component of duration and compues the minutes $minutes = round(($duration - floor($duration)) * 60); and this is obviously the hours $hours = floor($duration); and then I lose my way with
Comment 2: Hi Marc, The duration field is actually separate from the start and end time. This is done because some sessions can be over multiple days. When adding/editing a session, the number that is entered is in hours with fractional numbers allowed (see the contextual help next to that field). Then it is stored in the database as a number of minutes. Finally, it's displayed to users (on the signup page for example) in a nicer human-readable way: 1 hour 30 minutes. Cheers, Francois
Comment 3: I see now..... However, if I set the duraction per the context help screen to "20 minutes" and save and then copy or re-edit, the field is populated with 20, not 20 minutes, which suggests to me that "20 minutes" doesn;t work..... but if I set the field to .33 that does seem to behave as you suggest..... Soooooo, there is apparently still some issue, though not the one I thought - LOL
Comment 4: I have just added support for session durations like "1:20" or "0:10" in CVS . Cheers, Francois

Forum Post: 
Post title: User cannot sign up for a 2nd f2f session in the same course
Post description: Please forgive me if this is a duplicate post, but I did not locate it on the forum. I ran across an interesting issue today....a user was trying to sign up for a face to face session for the second time (he had already signed up for a previous session and wanted a refresher). The user received a message that "(Username) is already signed up for this face-to-face activity." The user had attended a previous session of this activity, but cannot sign up for a second identical session (different date and time). If I remove his attendance history from the previous session, then he can successfully be added into the current session. Although that is a short-term workaround, I would prefer not to use it in order to keep the integrity of our attendance records. I also verified that there is no record written to the 'mdl_facet0face_submissions' table until the user was removed from the previous session. Anyone else have this issue or find a fix? Thanks,
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: That's a good point. There is currently no support for multiple "attempts" in a Face-to-face activity. The way I can see this get implemented is: - allow students to signup to a session again if the other one is in the past - the grade would be the highest of all of the sessions - there would be a new activity setting to allow/disallow multiple attempts. This does involve quite a bit of development however because the database model will have to be extended to support more than one signup. I have created an issue on the tracker for this: http://tracker.moodle.org/browse/CONTRIB-1271 Cheers, Francois
Comment 2: Thank you much. BH

Forum Post: 
Post title: Making an individual session unavailable for booking
Post description: All I needed a way to make an individual session unavailable for booking.  Basically the instructor wanted to add students to specific sessions manually without the student signing up themselves.  To do this I changed the code in face-to-face/lib.php as shown below: // Only numbers allowed here $session->capacity = preg_replace('/[^\d]/', '', $session->capacity); $MAX_CAPACITY = 100000; if ($session->capacity < 0) { //changed from a 1 to a 0 to allow session capacity to be set to 0 so sessions can be closed. $session->capacity = 1; } elseif ($session->capacity > $MAX_CAPACITY) { $session->capacity = $MAX_CAPACITY; } The scenario is this:  The instructor has a session that has 25 seats, but 15 of those seats need to be held for a specific department.  Once those 15 seats are filled then the instructor opens the session for anyone else that wants to register.  Setting the capacity to 0 effectively allows the session to be created but makes the session unavailable for students to book.  The instructor(s) adds the 15 students from the department and then two weeks before class starts they change the capacity to the actual capacity of the class opening up the remaining seats to whoever wants to book it. I hope I have explained this well.  In my testing it seems to be working beautifully, I just wonder if I am breaking something else by doing this.  ANy thoughts of comments? Scott Karren
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Scott, I like your solution, I don't think it's gonna break anything. The only thing that you changed is the "< 1" to a "< 0" ?
Comment 2: Francois That is the only change that I made. I wonder if there might be a better way to handle this scenario. Of course better usually means more complicated. Scott Karren

Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Scott, The first one is by design. This is to allow a teacher to override the limit and sign up more students if they want to. Please file a bug though if it causes any problems (e.g. display problems). The second issue is configurable in the site-wide activity settings. Some mail readers (e.g. GroupWise) turn iCal attachments into a calendar item and make the email disappear completely. These people will need to enable the dual-email option if they want their staff to be able to read the confirmation email. As for the HTML editor, it would be possible to do this, but it hasn't been implemented yet. It is on our TODO list, it simply hasn't been a priority yet. Cheers, Francois
Comment 2: Francois Thanks for the info, it is very appreciated. With regards to the iCal emails. I looked in the site-wide face to face settings and the only option I have is to disable iCal emails for cancellation messages. Is there another option that I am missing? I have version 2008100300. As for the HTML editor, to implement this is it as simple as telling the details and email text boxes to use the html editor or are there other considerations with regards to how the face to face module sends emails out that need to be looked at? Scott Karren
Comment 3: Hi Scott, Sorry, I lied, the option isn't in the site-wide settings. It's per-user at the time of signup: - "email & iCal": you get two emails - "iCal only": you get a single email with an iCal attachment - "email only": a single email without attachments As for the HTML editor, if you search for "htmlbody" and "posthtml" in lib.php, that should be a good start. I would try to keep the plain text version in there as well for those people who can't get HTML emails (e.g. corporate policy). Feel free to share the good you have, this is definitely something that I'd like to see in the Face-to-face module. Francois

Forum Post: 
Post title: Face-to-face 1.4.0 released!
Post description: A new version of the Face-to-face module has been released. It is highly recommended that you upgrade to it since it includes some security fixes . New features in this release: There is now a list of user cancellations on the attendance page. The Participants report shows the expected data. User-level activity reports ("Outline" and "Complete" reports) are also populated. Other noteworthy improvements: The module now uses a custom field on the user profile page for the manager's email address instead of the MSN field. The attendance data is now stored in the gradebook. Important bug fixes: The session key is now checked in all user forms. The take attendance page now displays the actual attendance and allows teachers to untick checkboxes. iCalendar appointments are no longer sent for wait-listed sessions. Remove internationalisation from log entries. Default email messages are no longer set in the site-wide settings page, they should simply be overridden in the language pack. Francois, Catalyst IT

Post title: sql table facetoface_sessions_dates question
Post description: Hi, I have a small question regarding the sql table: facetoface_sessions_dates this tables contains the dates and times of sessions. but I see that the entries have duplicate sessionid. So for each sessionid, I have 2 entries with timestart and timefinish Why is that? Shouldn't there be only 1 entry? Does 1 entry represent the date and the other the time? Can someone explain to me pls why there are 2 entries for each sessionid? 10x in advance
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: You're right, this table can contain more than one date per session. This is to support the multi-day sessions. So for example if you want people to signup for a 2-day first aid course, you can create a single session which requires people to show up on both days. Cheers,

Post title: Face-to-face 1.2.0 released!
Post description: A new and improved version of the Face-to-face module is now ready to be downloaded: Download latest version It includes the following new features: Teachers can now sign users up for a session, even after the fact. Open Document Format support when downloading attendance Dutch translation by Peter-Anne Wissema But perhaps more importantly, it fixes a number of bugs, including these: Always mark reminders as sent, even when the email to the manager failed. Fix the default permissions to fix problems where a user is both student and teacher. Add an empty db/upgrade.php to fix upgrade problems on Moodle 1.9 Respect the system's date and currency format when displaying dates and costs. More details are available in the change log . As usual, please report bugs in the tracker or ask for help in this forum. Francois, Catalyst IT
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Thanks a lot, François, the new features look great! Noticed a small enhancement to be made into the lib.php. From row# 612, the texts on the "edit", "copy", "delete" and "attendees" -links are hardcoded, i.e. not defined using the lang-files. Easy to fix, thought I'd mention it anyway..
Comment 2: Thanks for catching this Timo, it's now fixed.
